newsitem.title: USA: International Aero wins aircraft engine contract.
newsitem.headline: International Aero wins aircraft engine contract.

text.p: International Aero Engines said Thursday it had won a $30 million contract from UK-based Monarch Airlines to power Monarch's new fleet of Airbus A321 aircraft.

International Aero is a consortium in which United Technologies Corp unit Pratt & Whitney owns 33 percent; Rolls-Royce Plc owns 33 percent; and Daimler-Benz AG unit MTU owns 12 percent. The balance is owned by Japanese Aero Engines Corp.
International Aero said Monarch's three A321-200 aircraft will be the first to enter service with the 33,000-pound-thrust V2533 engine, the most powerful V2500 variant ever produced by the company.
Monarch's initial A321, entering service in April, will be leased from International Lease Finance Corp. It will be followed by two purchased A321s to be delivered in 1999.
British charter operator Monarch will use the aircraft on flights between the U.K. and the Mediterranean.
Monarch is a new customer for the 13-year-old International Aero consortium.
